OnePlus One

Oppo N1 CM Edition
Difference between an incremental and a full update An incremental update can only be installed if you were running the latest version before this update was released.\n\nA full update can be always be installed - regardless of your current software version running on your device. Downloading Cyanogen OS Update…
Welcome to Cyanogen update tracker! This app will allow you to stay informed about the latest Android™ updates for your Cyanogen® OS powered device. \n\nSwipe to the left to continue. Choose your device: In order to stay up-to-date, you will need to choose a device from the list shown above.\n\nMore devices will be automatically added when they are released!\n\nSwipe to the left to continue. Choose your update method: For most of the devices, there are two update methods shown in the list above. These are the full and the incremental update.\n\nA full update contains everything and can always be installed on your device.\n\nAn incremental update can only be installed if you had the latest version before the new update was released.\nChoose this for faster downloads or if you are low on storage space.\n\nSwipe to the left to continue. You are ready to start! Enjoy using this application!\n\nYou can always change your settings by clicking the three dots in the top right corner (or press your Menu button) and then clicking on 'change device and update settings'. start app
Tutorial image. Download the update. Press the Download button to start the download process. The download will appear in your notifications screen. When it\'s done, you\'ll see a notification like this:
Enter Recovery Mode. - Turn off your phone first. - Press both the power and the volume down button at the same time. - Wait until you see the recovery menu on your screen.
Apply the downloaded update. - Within the recovery menu, choose Apply Update. - Select Choose from Internal Storage. - Go to 0, Download, and select the zip file matching the tile shown within the app.
Restart your device. - Within the recovery menu, choose Reboot System Now. - Your device will show the Cyanogen logo for a long time while it is updating. - After this step, you\'ll see \'Android is upgrading\' while your apps are being optimized.
Done. Enjoy your new Cyanogen OS! - After your device has finished the update process, you can check the version of your system: - Go to Settings, About Phone, and check the Cyanogen OS Version. - If you like this app, give it 5 stars at Google Play! Close Installation Guide
Device image Your device: System on a Chip: Processor Frequency: Amount of memory: Graphics chip: Battery capacity: System version: Serial number:
Version: Rate on Google Play An app to track Cyanogen OS updates. This app is written by Arjan Vlek, an IT-interested guy living in Zoetermeer, The Netherlands.\n\nThis app is inspired by a website (click), which provides similar functionality. This app aims to be more user-friendly and to offer more features.\n\nIn the future, your device will be detected automatically. \n\nIf you like my app, please rate it on Google play now:
